alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:40PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Canyon, northwestern Owyhee and east central Malheur Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 340 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Owyhee Reservoir, or 26 miles southwest of Parma, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Owyhee Dam around 400 PM MDT. Wilder, Adrian and Shell Rock Butte around 410 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
